awards.description: NAY'DINI'AA NA' KAYAX' U?E? ?STESTNIIC : CHICKALOON NATIVE VILLAGE STARTING TO BE AWARE OFVULNERABILITY ASSESSMENT PROJECT

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE CHICKALOON NATIVE VILLAGE IN BUILDING CAPACITIES AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH.  OBJECTIVES/WORKPLAN COMPONENTS INCLUDE: 1) BUILDING ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY; 2) BUILDING PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY; 3) BUILDING COMMUNICATIONS CAPACITY; 4) BUILDING SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT CAPACITY; AND 5) BUILDING TECHNICAL CAPACITY.ACTIVITIES:WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES/TASKS INCLUDE: MAINTAINING AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT FUNCTIONS; ATTENDING TRAINING AND RESEARCHING ISSUES AND RESOURCES; COMMUNICATING INTERNALLY AND EXTERNALLY ABOUT ISSUES AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY EDUCATION ACTIVITIES; BUILDING TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE OF WATER QUALITY AND ECOSYSTEMS; DEVELOPING RECYCLING AND SURFACE WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAMS; AND COLLECTING BASELINE SURFACE WATER QUALITY DATA.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE CHICKALOON NATIVE VILLAGE, TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND THE LOCAL PUBLIC. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: INCREASING TRIBAL ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS; INCREASING TRIBAL PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY TO ASSESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; INCREASING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ACTIONS PROTECTIVE OF THE ENVIRONMENT; DECREASING AMOUNTS OF RECYCLABLES AND HAZARDOUS WASTES ENTERING LANDFILL; AND INCREASING TRIBAL TECHNICAL CAPACITIES TO PRIORITIZE ENVIRONMENTAL NEEDS AND DEVELOP PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THEM. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: PERFORMANCE REPORTS; FINANCIAL REPORTS; COPIES OF OUTREACH MATERIALS; EVENT SUMMARY REPORTS; AND BASELINE WATER QUALITY MONITORING REPORTS.

BUILDING TECHNICAL CAPACITY.ACTIVITIES:WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES/TASKS INCLUDE: MAINTAINING AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT FUNCTIONS; ATTENDING TRAINING AND RESEARCHING ISSUES AND RESOURCES; COMMUNICATING INTERNALLY AND EXTERNALLY ABOUT ISSUES AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY EDUCATION ACTIVITIES; CONDUCTING RECYCLING ACTIVITIES; BUILDING TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE OF WATER AND ECOSYSTEMS; DEVELOPING RECYCLING AND SURFACE WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAMS; AND COLLECTING BASELINE SURFACE WATER QUALITY DATA. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: INCREASING TRIBAL ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS; INCREASING TRIBAL PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY TO ASSESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; INCREASING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ACTIONS PROTECTIVE OF THE ENVIRONMENT; DECREASING AMOUNTS OF RECYCLABLES AND HAZARDOUS WASTES ENTERING LANDFILL; AND INCREASING TRIBAL TECHNICAL CAPACITIES TO PRIORITIZE ENVIRONMENTAL NEEDS AND DEVELOP PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THEM.  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: PERFORMANCE REPORTS; FINANCIAL REPORTS; COPIES OF OUTREACH MATERIALS; EVENT SUMMARY REPORTS; RECYCLING REPORTS; AND BASELINE WATER QUALITY MONITORING REPORTS.

PROJECT TITLE: CHICKALOON NATIVE VILLAGE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FUNDING FY 2024 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDING PROVIDED BY FHWA TO CHICKALOON NATIVE VILLAGE UNDER THE FHWA OTT PROGRAM AGREEMENT FOR FY24
